result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:13 AM Defendant Rodney W Tyler in court.  Attorney Mitchell Philbin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney David Moss in court for Rodney W Tyler. 
Court calls cases 22CF7, 21CT101, 22CT22, 22TR39 and 22TR40.
Atty Moss provides plea form.
ADA heard on agreement.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1 of 22CF7.
Deft enters a plea of guilty.
Non-citizen advisory.
No firearms.
May not vote or serve on jury until civil rights are restored.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Elements of offense.
Court reviews prior convictions.
Deft agrees.
Atty Moss agrees.
Atty Moss satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty to Count 1 of 22CF7.
Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2 of 22CF7, Count 1 of 21CT101, and Count 1 of 22CT22.
Court dismisses outright Count 3 of 22CF7, Count 1 of 22TR39, and Count 1 of 22TR40.
9:31 off record.
9:32 back on record.
Court schedules with parties.
Court orders presentence investigation be completed.  Agent to provide report to court at least 2 weeks prior to sentencing. 
Court orders Deft to cooperate with the PSI process.
Deft remanded into the custody of the Marinette County Sheriff Department.
9:33 AM
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing on August 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Order allowing Defendant to reschedule status/plea
Proposed order granting motion to reschedule (Status/Plea)

Defendant Rodney W Tyler in court with Attorney David Moss. Prosecuting Atty robert James mraz appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Court finds Deft freely waives prelim.
Deft bound over for trial.
3:02 p.m.
  Arraignment scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

08:55 AM Defendant Rodney W Tyler in court with attorney David Moss.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court calls cases 22cf7, 22tr39, and 22TR40.
Atty Moss heard - represents in other cases and will represent on these as well.

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Order For Defendant To Abstain From Alcohol And For Testing

09:32 AM Defendant Rodney W Tyler in court with attorney Jon G Spansail.  Defendant Rodney W Tyler in custody.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rodney W Tyler appeared by video means with Attorney.
Court calls cases 22CF7, 22TR39 and 22TR40.
Atty Spansail appears for bond purposes only.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Spansail heard on bond.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $1000 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid RX, may not operate a motor vehicle without a vaild license, Compliance with Soberlink,   No entry into any bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Deft to contact the Public Defenders office today.
Court schedules with parties.
